task_summary: Perceive a pink cloth, approach and make gentle contact, then push to fold it and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A single robotic arm manipulates a small pink cloth on a wooden tabletop. The goal is to fold the cloth by making contact and pushing one section over itself, resulting in a smaller, neatly folded rectangle. The sequence emphasizes perception, cautious approach, contact detection, a directed push along the fold line, short settling time, and a safe retreat. No grasping is used; folding is performed via contact and pushing. Constraints include low force during contact and accurate alignment to avoid dragging the cloth off the workspace.
preconditions: Cloth is on the table within reachable workspace
Camera view of the cloth is available
Table surface is dry and provides moderate friction
stepwise_plan: Move above the cloth at a safe height
Lower slowly until contact is detected
Push along the intended fold direction to fold the cloth
Pause briefly to allow the cloth to settle
success_criteria: Cloth appears folded into a smaller rectangle
Cloth remains on the table within workspace
Arm retreats to a safe position
failure_and_recovery: Contact not detected: re-approach and lower again
Push misaligned: re-approach and attempt a shorter push
Cloth slips: reduce push distance and retry
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after the retreat step completes and the cloth remains stably folded.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Open the gripper to avoid snagging the cloth during approach.
Vision step to localize the cloth.
Move to a pre-contact pose above the cloth.
Descend gently until contact is detected with the surface/cloth.
Execute the folding push along the chosen direction.
Allow the cloth to settle after folding.
Back away to a safe standoff pose.

failure_modes: Push direction misaligned causing translation instead of folding
recovery_strategy: Reduce approach speed and repeat contact attempt
Shorter corrective pushes with updated direction
Abort and request human intervention if cloth leaves workspace
assumptions: Frames show single-arm push-based folding rather than a two-handed pick-and-place fold.
